intro: Pavetta bengalensis, commonly known as the Bengal pavetta, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forests and shrublands. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its propagation in natural habitats.
